components.trigger:
Type
Trigger 5s after initialization. Prompt Random data Prompt label
Data The prompt value will be assigned to the {prompt} keyword in the code.
The component triggers data into the Flow.
$NAME
components.chatgpt:
By using this component you can asks ChatGPT / OpenAPI. It utilizes the [Total.js ChatGPT API](https://docs.totaljs.com/totalapi/6c221003eo51c/#128fm001kc51d). __Input data:__ ```js // {String} a question for ChatGPT 'What is Total.js Platform' ``` __Output data__: If `output` is set as Text: ```js { text: 'Total.js Platform is a web development platform that provides a comprehensive set of tools and modules for building modern, scalable, and high-performance web applications. It is based on the Node.js runtime and offers a seamless development experience with a powerful, intuitive, and easy-to-use framework. Total.js Platform includes features such as database integration, real-time communication, server-side rendering, RESTful API support, and more. It also supports various front-end technologies and integrates seamlessly with popular third-party libraries and services, making it a great choice for building full-stack web applications.' } ``` If `output` is set as Image: Returns data according to the component configuration Response type. It can be `Buffer`, `Base64` or `DataURI`.

Get Total.js API token.
The token field supports variables in the form {variable}.

API token
Path for reading input data
Optional. This component will load input data from a specific property/field according to the path.
Output
Size
Response type
$NAME

Shows repository Shows data

components.printjson:
The component prints incoming data in a JSON format.
Shows repository Shows data

components.code:
This component executes a custom JavaScript code as it is. To send data to the default output use `send(somedata);` To send data to specific output when number of outputs > 1 use `$.send('outputX', somedata)` where `X` is output index, see example bellow: - first output--> `send(somedata)` or `$.send('output', somedata)` - second output --> `$.send('output2', somedata)` - ... - 5th output --> `$.send('output5', somedata)` - etc.
Name
Number of outputs
Code:
NAME

config.name: Code

components.tapirouter:
This component routes incoming Total.js API data according to the defined API schema. The component extends input data (query, payload and params) with parsed data. __Input & Output data__: ```js { // REQUIRED payload: payload: { schema: 'schema_name/{param_1}/{param_2}?query=arguments', data: {} // optional, request payload }, ip: String, // optional, IP address url: String, // optional language: String, // optional ua: String, // optional, parsed UA user: Object, // optional headers: { key: String }, // optional, request headers cookies: { key: String }, // optional, cookies query: { key: String }, // optional params: { key: String }, // optional files: [{ type: String, filename: String, path: String, ext: String, size: Number, width: Number, height: Number }] // optional } ``` In the case of `error`, the input data is extended by the `response` property with an error.
$NAME
Every name of identifier must be unique per Flow. You can use dynamic arguments in the form {argument_name}
Use names in lower-case. We recommend to keep e.g. users_read/{id} or products_read/{id}
components.tauthtoken:
This component must be used only with REST Route component. It reads a token from the request header and compares it with the token declared in the configuration.
Token
Generate token. It can contain a global variable in the form {variable}.
Status code
Header
Error message
DDOS protection
How many times can the client requested your API with a bad key? The internal IP database is cleared every 10 minutes. 0 disables DDOS protection.
$NAME
components.tapicaptchaapi:
Captcha image generator generates a simple JPEG image. It utilizes the [Total.js Weather API](https://docs.totaljs.com/totalapi/6c221003eo51c/#Ii6INR1cR61f). __Input data:__ ```js // {String} Captcha text '123456' ``` __Output data__: ```js // Returns DataURI 'data:image/jpeg;base64,/9j/4AAQSkZ...'' ```

Get Total.js API token.
The token field supports variables in the form {variable}.

API token
Path for reading input data
Optional. This component will load input data from a specific property/field according to the path.
Width
Height
Dark mode
$NAME
components.chatgpt:
This component can talk to ChatGPT. ## Input Input will depend on selected model - __CPT 3.5 Turbo__ and __CPT 4__ ```js // Object { messages : [{ role: 'user', content: 'Text' }] } // or // Array [{ role: 'assistant', content: 'Text' }] ``` - __Whisper__ ```js // Object { path : 'path-to-file' } // or // String 'path-to-file' ``` - __CPT 3.5 Turbo instruct__ ```js // Object { text : 'your question' } // or // String 'your question' ``` ## Output Output also depends on selected model - __CPT 3.5 Turbo__ and __CPT 4__ ```js 'Response from assistant' ``` - __Whisper__ ```js // Object { text : 'transcipted text' } ``` - __CPT 3.5 Turbo instruct__ ```js // String 'Response from assistant' ```
API key
Generate API key
Model
Question
This question will be added before your messages
NAME

Name
Number of outputs
Code:

components.tcors:
The component enables Cross-Origin Resource Sharing `CORS`, so the web browser will be able to communicate directly with the REST API. The functionality will work only with a defined Proxy endpoint for this Flow.
Hostnames with a protocol
CORS enabled
components.tapicheckapi:
Returns a current status for your token. It utilizes the [Total.js Check API](https://docs.totaljs.com/totalapi/6c221003eo51c/#6d397001td51c). __Output data__: ```js { credits: 34.49 } ```

Get Total.js API token.
The token field supports variables in the form {variable}.

API token
$NAME
components.cheerio:
Uses [Cheerio](https://cheerio.js.org/index.html) Please refer to the [documentation](https://cheerio.js.org/classes/Cheerio.html) for available functions. ## Input ```js ``` ## Output ```js { result: , input: } ``` ## Example code ```js // instance : component instance // $: cheerio instance // html: html string var txt = []; $('ul > li').each(function (i, elem) { txt.push($(this).text()); }); return txt; ```
Path to html
Leave empty if the 'data' itself is the html string, otherwise use dot notation. E.g.: { request: { body: '<html>...</html>' }} -> `request.body`
Code:
Available variables: '$' -> cheerio instance, 'html' -> html string. Use 'return somedata;' to return whatever you want. Output data -> { result: somedata, input: inputdata }
NAME
components.dataset:
Name
Type
Calculate the sum
Unit
Decimals
Icon
Color

Zero values will prevent statistics from being displayed for the selected period.

Hours
How many hours to be returned?
Days
How many days to be returned?
Months
How many months to be returned?
Years
How many years to be returned?
 The component stores data as CSV Dataset for e.g. Dashboard application. Dataset is stored in `/private/` path that is available with the help of the Flow access token. CSV file contains only processed values (according to the period) and the `.meta` file contains meta data + last value. __Input for data processing__: ```js { key: String, // optional, e.g. device_id | device_name value: Number // measured value } ``` ### CSV columns - `a` = `key {String}` - `b` = `value {Number}` - `c` = `min {Number}` - `d` = `max {Number}` - `e` = `sum {Number}` - `f` = `count {Number}` - `g` = `tshour {Number}`in the form `yyyyMMddhh` - `h` = `tsday {Number}` in the form `yyyyMMdd` - `i` = `tsweek {Number}` in the form `yyyyww` - `j` = `tsmonth {Number}` in the form `yyyyMM` - `k` = `tsyear {Number}` in the form `yyyy`
NAME
components.opensync:
This component receives a data from the [OpenSync](https://docs.totaljs.com/opensync/) app. Data example: ```js { id: String, // Internal ID type: String, // Parsed content-type (can be empty with the "GET" method) channel: String, // Channel ip: String, // Host IP address method: String, // HTTP method (upper-case) headers: Object, // Key:value query: Object, // Key:value body: Object, // JSON/key:value/String ua: String, // Parsed user-agent files: [Object Array] // Uploaded files { filename: String, extension: String, type: String, size: Number, url: String, width: Number, height: Number } } ```
URL address + token
Enter URL address + token to the OpenSync server. This component will connect to the OpenSync via WebSocket.
NAME
components.filewriter:
Path
Absolute path to the file. The path starts with the ~ char will use a filename in the project's root directory.
Serializer Rewrite content
Divider
The component writes incoming data into the file.
NAME
